intro: Calandrinia tricolor, commonly known as the pink morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has a trailing growth habit and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Calandrinia tricolor is a member of the Malvaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
